name: Splice Sprint
description: Race forward on a procedural track that constantly splits into forking paths â€” swipe to pick your lane before each fork, chaining the best route through speed boosts, jumps, and shortcuts while wrong picks dead-end or slow you down.
core_loop: Your runner auto-moves forward at increasing speed. Every 1-3 seconds the track visibly splits into 2-3 forking branches ahead of you. You swipe left/right (or tap lane buttons) to commit to a branch before the fork arrives. Good picks reward speed boosts, coin trails, or ramp jumps; bad picks hit mud patches, narrow wobbly bridges, or crumbling dead-ends that cost time. Forks come faster as speed increases, creating a frantic read-and-react rhythm. Collecting coins unlocks cosmetic trail effects between runs.
retention_hooks: Escalating speed makes each run feel like a mounting personal challenge â€” you always feel like you could have gone just a bit further
Forking paths are semi-random so memorization never fully works, but pattern recognition improves with play, giving a genuine skill curve
Post-run summary shows 'optimal route' ghost line overlaid on your choices, motivating a rematch to beat your decision accuracy percentage
controls: Swipe left/right on mobile (or left/right arrow keys on desktop) to pick a fork branch. Single-axis input only â€” no jumping, no complex combos. One-finger play.
